title: 820-01041 no display.
message:
small water damage at screen connector on the screen side(not get to the mac logic board).
working fine with external screen, replaced screen with good know but the same.
replaced U9850 still same...no display no backlight

title: 820-01041 no display.
message:
Something else damaged by liquid.

The affected connector has direct connections with MLB.
Do not think that liquid didn't affect MLB.
A spike from backlight output to a data line, went back to MLB, of course.

Sometime only U9850 gets bad, but not always; is question of luck.
Be sure U9850 is properly soldered and surrounding components in place.

title: 820-01041 no display.
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 70788, member: 682"]
U9850 is properly soldered and surrounding components in place.
[/QUOTE]
did it 2 times all look good...where else can i check?

title: 820-01041 no display.
message:
Do you get 3V3/5V_S0SW at J8500?
DP_INT_HPD goes high?
Change U5210, just in case.

title: 820-01041 no display.
message:
DP_INT_HPD 0v diode mode 645
LCD_MUX_EN 3.3v 
PP5V_S0SW_LCD - 5.1V
PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F 5.1V
PP3V3_S0SW_LCD 3.3V 
EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN 3.3v

title: 820-01041 no display.
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 71871, member: 682"]
DP_INT_HPD goes high?
[/QUOTE]
DP_INT_HPD should be high just with lcd connecting?

title: 820-01041 no display.
message:
DP_INT_HPD can only go high if LCD is connected.
If stays low, PCH cannot detect LCD presence; internal eDP output is then disabled.
You have a problem with LCD assembly, J8500, or video flex.
